metadata.title: CVE-2018-10880 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Linux kernel is vulnerable to a stack-out-of-bounds write in the ext4filesystem code when mounting and writing to a crafted ext4 image inext4_update_inline_data(). An attacker could use this to cause a systemcrash and a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10880` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-139-generic - 4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-139-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-139-lowlatency - 4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-139-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-139-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-139-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-139-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-139-generic - 4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1034-aws - 4.4.0-1034.37
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1037-azure - 4.15.0-1037.39~14.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').

linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-139.165~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1034.37').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1037.39~14.04.2').
